   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, one client, one server.
   23: %% The traffic isn't meant to be sensible, just to exercise code.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_traffic_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0,
   30:          run/1]).
   31: 
   32: %% common_test wrapping
   33: -export([suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          parallel/1]).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases
   38: -export([send_ok/1,
   39:          send_nok/1,
   40:          send_eval/1,
   41:          send_bad_answer/1,
   42:          send_protocol_error/1,
   43:          send_experimental_result/1,
   44:          send_arbitrary/1,
   45:          send_proxy_info/1,
   46:          send_unknown/1,
   47:          send_unknown_short/1,
   48:          send_unknown_mandatory/1,
   49:          send_unknown_short_mandatory/1,
   50:          send_noreply/1,
   51:          send_grouped_error/1,
   52:          send_unsupported/1,
   53:          send_unsupported_app/1,
   54:          send_error_bit/1,
   55:          send_unsupported_version/1,
   56:          send_long_avp_length/1,
   57:          send_short_avp_length/1,
   58:          send_zero_avp_length/1,
   59:          send_invalid_avp_length/1,
   60:          send_invalid_reject/1,
   61:          send_unexpected_mandatory_decode/1,
   62:          send_unexpected_mandatory/1,
   63:          send_too_many/1,
   64:          send_long/1,
   65:          send_maxlen/1,
   66:          send_nopeer/1,
   67:          send_noapp/1,
   68:          send_discard/1,
   69:          send_any_1/1,
   70:          send_any_2/1,
   71:          send_all_1/1,
   72:          send_all_2/1,
   73:          send_timeout/1,
   74:          send_error/1,
   75:          send_detach/1,
   76:          send_encode_error/1,
   77:          send_destination_1/1,
   78:          send_destination_2/1,
   79:          send_destination_3/1,
   80:          send_destination_4/1,
   81:          send_destination_5/1,
   82:          send_destination_6/1,
   83:          send_bad_option_1/1,
   84:          send_bad_option_2/1,
   85:          send_bad_filter_1/1,
   86:          send_bad_filter_2/1,
   87:          send_bad_filter_3/1,
   88:          send_bad_filter_4/1,
   89:          send_multiple_filters_1/1,
   90:          send_multiple_filters_2/1,
   91:          send_multiple_filters_3/1,
   92:          send_anything/1]).
   93: 
   94: %% diameter callbacks
   95: -export([peer_up/4,
   96:          peer_down/4,
   97:          pick_peer/7, pick_peer/8,
   98:          prepare_request/6, prepare_request/7,
   99:          prepare_retransmit/6,
  100:          handle_answer/7, handle_answer/8,
  101:          handle_error/7,
  102:          handle_request/4]).
  103: 
  104: %% diameter_{tcp,sctp} callbacks
  105: -export([message/3]).
  106: 
  107: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
  108: 
  109: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
  110: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
  111: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_accounting.hrl").
  112: %% The listening transports use RFC 3588 dictionaries, the client
  113: %% transports use either 3588 or 6733. (So can't use the record
  114: %% definitions in the latter case.)
  115: 
  116: %% ===========================================================================
  117: 
  118: -define(util, diameter_util).
  119: 
  120: -define(A, list_to_atom).
  121: -define(L, atom_to_list).
  122: -define(B, iolist_to_binary).
  123: 
  124: %% Don't use is_record/2 since dictionary hrl's aren't included.
  125: %% (Since they define conflicting records with the same names.)
  126: -define(is_record(Rec, Name), (Name == element(1, Rec))).
  127: 
  128: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
  129: 
  130: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
  131: -define(HOST(Host, Realm), Host ++ [$.|Realm]).
  132: 
  133: -define(EXTRA, an_extra_argument).
  134: 
  135: %% Sequence mask for End-to-End and Hop-by-Hop identifiers.
  136: -define(CLIENT_MASK, {1,26}).  %% 1 in top 6 bits
  137: 
  138: %% How to construct outgoing messages.
  139: -define(ENCODINGS, [list, record, map]).
  140: 
  141: %% How to decode incoming messages.
  142: -define(DECODINGS, [record, none, map, list, record_from_map]).
  143: 
  144: %% Which dictionary to use in the clients.
  145: -define(RFCS, [rfc3588, rfc6733, rfc4005]).
  146: 
  147: %% Which transport protocol to use.
  148: -define(TRANSPORTS, [sctp || ?util:have_sctp()] ++ [tcp]).
  149: 
  150: -record(group, {transport,
  151:                 strings,
  152:                 encoding,
  153:                 client_service,
  154:                 client_dict,
  155:                 client_sender,
  156:                 server_service,
  157:                 server_decoding,
  158:                 server_sender,
  159:                 server_throttle}).
  160: 
  161: %% Not really what we should be setting unless the message is sent in
  162: %% the common application but diameter doesn't care.
  163: -define(APP_ID, ?DIAMETER_APP_ID_COMMON).
  164: 
  165: %% An Application-ID the server doesn't support.
  166: -define(BAD_APP, 42).
  167: 
  168: %% A common match when receiving answers in a client.
  169: -define(answer_message(SessionId, ResultCode),
  170:         ['answer-message' | #{'Session-Id' := SessionId,
  171:                               'Origin-Host' := _,
  172:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  173:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  174: -define(answer_message(ResultCode),
  175:         ['answer-message' | #{'Origin-Host' := _,
  176:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  177:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  178: 
  179: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
  180: -define(SERVICE(Name, Grp),
  181:         [{'Origin-Host', Name ++ "." ++ ?REALM},
  182:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
  183:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
  184:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
  185:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
  186:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]},  %% common messages
  187:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},  %% base accounting
  188:          {restrict_connections, false},
  189:          {string_decode, Grp#group.strings},
  190:          {avp_dictionaries, [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683]},
  191:          {incoming_maxlen, 1 bsl 21}
  192:          | [{application, [{dictionary, D},
  193:                            {module, [?MODULE, Grp]},
  194:                            {answer_errors, callback}]}
  195:             || D <- [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  196:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting,
  197:                      diameter_gen_base_rfc6733,
  198:                      diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733,
  199:                      nas4005],
  200:                D /= nas4005 orelse have_nas()]]).
  201: 
  202: -define(SUCCESS,
  203:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_SUCCESS').
  204: -define(COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  205:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED').
  206: -define(TOO_BUSY,
  207:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_TOO_BUSY').
  208: -define(APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  209:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED').
  210: -define(INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  211:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_HDR_BITS').
  212: -define(INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  213:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_BITS').
  214: -define(AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  215:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_UNSUPPORTED').
  216: -define(UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  217:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION').
  218: -define(TOO_MANY,
  219:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_OCCURS_TOO_MANY_TIMES').
  220: -define(REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  221:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_REALM_NOT_SERVED').
  222: -define(UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  223:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNABLE_TO_DELIVER').
  224: -define(INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  225:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_LENGTH').
  226: 
  227: -define(EVENT_RECORD,
  228:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_ACCOUNTING-RECORD-TYPE_EVENT_RECORD').
  229: -define(AUTHORIZE_ONLY,
  230:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_ONLY').
  231: -define(AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE,
  232:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE').
  233: 
  234: -define(LOGOUT,
  235:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  236: -define(BAD_ANSWER,
  237:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_BAD_ANSWER').
  238: -define(USER_MOVED,
  239:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
  240: 
  241: %% ===========================================================================
  242: %% common_test wrapping
  243: 
  244: suite() ->
  245:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  246: 
  247: all() ->
  248:     [parallel].
  249: 
  250: parallel(_Config) ->
  251:     run().
  252: 
  253: %% ===========================================================================
  254: 
  255: %% run/0
  256: %%
  257: %% The test cases proper, do or (meaningfully) die.
  258: %%
  259: %% Randomly choose one of many configuration possibilities. Testing
  260: %% all of them takes too much time, and randomly skipping various
  261: %% cases (as used to be the case) just unnecessary complexity. There
  262: %% are run night after night in on various hosts, so just choosing a
  263: %% configuration results in sufficient coverage over time.
  264: 
  265: run() ->
  266:     Svc = ?util:unique_string(),
  267:     run(#group{transport = ?util:choose(?TRANSPORTS),
  268:                strings = bool(),
  269:                encoding = ?util:choose(?ENCODINGS),
  270:                client_service = [$C | Svc],
  271:                client_dict = appdict(?util:choose(?RFCS)),
  272:                client_sender = bool(),
  273:                server_service = [$S | Svc],
  274:                server_decoding = ?util:choose(?DECODINGS),
  275:                server_sender = true,  %% avoid deadlock
  276:                server_throttle = bool()}).
  277: 
  278: %% run/1
  279: 
  280: run(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  281:     _ = result_codes(Cfg),
  282:     io:format("config: ~p~n", [Cfg]),
  283:     try
  284:         ?util:run([{[fun traffic/1, Cfg], 60000}])
  285:     after
  286:         code:delete(nas4005),
  287:         code:purge(nas4005),
  288:         diameter:stop()
  289:     end.
  290: 
  291: %% traffic/1
  292: 
  293: traffic(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  294:     _ = compile_and_load(),
  295:     ok = diameter:start(),
  296:     LRef = server(Cfg),
  297:     ok = client(Cfg, LRef),
  298:     [] = send(Cfg),
  299:     ok = stop_services(Cfg),
  300:     [] = ets:tab2list(diameter_request).
  301: 
  302: %% start_service/2
  303: 
  304: start_service(Svc, Opts) ->
  305:     {ok, _} = {diameter:start_service(Svc, Opts), Opts},
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: %% send/1
  309: 
  310: send(Cfg) ->
  311:     Ref = make_ref(),
  312:     Refs = [R || {F,1} <- module_info(exports),
  313:                  "send_" ++ _ <- [atom_to_list(F)],
  314:                  I <- [fun() -> exit({Ref, send(F, Cfg)}) end],
  315:                  {_,R} <- [spawn_monitor(I)]],
  316:     lists:filter(fun({R,_}) -> R /= Ref; (_) -> true end, wait(Refs)).
  317: 
  318: %% send/2
  319: 
  320: send(F, #group{transport = sctp})
  321:   when F == send_long;
  322:        F == send_maxlen ->
  323:     ok;
  324: 
  325: send(F, Cfg) ->
  326:     timer:sleep(rand:uniform(2000)),
  327:     apply(?MODULE, F, [[{testcase, F}, {group, Cfg}]]).
  328: 
  329: %% wait/1
  330: 
  331: wait(Refs)
  332:   when is_list(Refs) ->
  333:     lists:map(fun wait/1, Refs);
  334: 
  335: wait(MRef) ->
  336:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, T} -> T end.
  337: 
  338: %% ===========================================================================
  339: 
  340: %% server/1
  341: 
  342: server(Config) ->
  343:     #group{transport = T,
  344:            client_sender = CS,
  345:            server_service = SN,
  346:            server_decoding = SD,
  347:            server_sender = SS,
  348:            server_throttle = ST}
  349:         = Grp
  350:         = group(Config),
  351:     ok = start_service(SN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  352:                             {decode_format, SD}
  353:                             | ?SERVICE(SN, Grp)]),
  354:     Cfg = [{sender, SS},
  355:            {message_cb, ST andalso {?MODULE, message, [0]}}]
  356:         ++ [{packet, ?util:choose([false, raw])} || T == sctp andalso CS]
  357:         ++ [{unordered, unordered()} || T == sctp],
  358:     Opts = [{capabilities_cb, fun capx/2},
  359:             {pool_size, 8}
  360:            | server_apps()],
  361:     _LRef = ?util:listen(SN, [T | Cfg], Opts).
  362: 
  363: %% client/1
  364: 
  365: client(Config, LRef) ->
  366:     #group{transport = T,
  367:            encoding = E,
  368:            client_service = CN,
  369:            client_sender = CS}
  370:         = Grp
  371:         = group(Config),
  372:     ok = start_service(CN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  373:                             {sequence, ?CLIENT_MASK},
  374:                             {decode_format, map},
  375:                             {strict_arities, decode}
  376:                             | ?SERVICE(CN, Grp)]),
  377:     _ = [?util:connect(CN, [T | C], LRef, O)
  378:          || C <- [[{sender, CS} | client_opts(T)]],
  379:             D <- ?DECODINGS,  %% for multiple candidate peers
  380:             R <- ?RFCS,
  381:             R /= rfc4005 orelse have_nas(),
  382:             I <- [{D,E}],
  383:             O <- [[{id, I}
  384:                   | client_apps(R, [{'Origin-State-Id', origin(I)}])]]],
  385:     ok.
  386: 
  387: bool() ->
  388:     0.5 =< rand:uniform().
  389: 
  390: unordered() ->
  391:     ?util:choose([true, false, 1, 2]).
  392: 
  393: client_opts(tcp) ->
  394:     [];
  395: client_opts(sctp) ->
  396:     [{unordered, unordered()}
  397:      | [{sctp_initmsg, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = N,
  398:                                      max_instreams = 5}}
  399:         || N <- [rand:uniform(8)],
  400:            N =< 6]].
  401: 
  402: server_apps() ->
  403:     B = have_nas(),
  404:     [{applications, [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  405:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting]
  406:                     ++ [nas4005 || B]},
  407:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [0] ++ [1 || B]}, %% common, NAS
  408:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]}]}].          %% accounting
  409: 
  410: client_apps(rfc4005, Caps) ->
  411:     [{applications, [nas4005]},
  412:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [1]},     %% NAS
  413:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', []}
  414:                     | Caps]}];
  415: client_apps(D, Caps) ->
  416:     D0 = dict0(D),
  417:     [{applications, [acct(D0), D0]},
  418:      {capabilities, Caps}].
  419: 
  420: have_nas() ->
  421:     false /= code:is_loaded(nas4005).
  422: 
  423: stop_services(Config) ->
  424:     #group{client_service = CN,
  425:            server_service = SN}
  426:         = group(Config),
  427:     ok = diameter:stop_service(CN),
  428:     ok = diameter:stop_service(SN).
  429: 
  430: capx(_, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,DH}}) ->
  431:     io:format("connection: ~p -> ~p~n", [DH,OH]),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: %% ===========================================================================
  435: 
  436: %% Ensure that result codes have the expected values.
  437: result_codes(_Config) ->
  438:     {2001,
  439:      3001, 3002, 3003, 3004, 3007, 3008, 3009,
  440:      5001, 5009, 5011, 5014}
  441:         = {?SUCCESS,
  442:            ?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  443:            ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  444:            ?REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  445:            ?TOO_BUSY,
  446:            ?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  447:            ?INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  448:            ?INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  449:            ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  450:            ?TOO_MANY,
  451:            ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  452:            ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH}.
  453: 
  454: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  455: send_ok(Config) ->
  456:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  457:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 1}],
  458:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  459:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  460:         = call(Config, Req).
  461: 
  462: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server answers badly to.
  463: send_nok(Config) ->
  464:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  465:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 0}],
  466: 
  467:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_AVP_BITS)
  468:         = call(Config, Req).
  469: 
  470: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  471: send_eval(Config) ->
  472:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  473:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 3}],
  474: 
  475:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  476:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  477:         = call(Config, Req).
  478: 
  479: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server tries to answer with an
  480: %% inappropriate header. That the error is detected is coded in
  481: %% handle_answer.
  482: send_bad_answer(Config) ->
  483:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  484:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 2}],
  485:     ?answer_message(?SUCCESS)
  486:         = call(Config, Req).
  487: 
  488: %% Send an ACR that the server callback answers explicitly with a
  489: %% protocol error and some AVPs to check the decoding of.
  490: send_protocol_error(Config) ->
  491:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  492:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 4}],
  493: 
  494:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := ?TOO_BUSY,
  495:                           'AVP' := [OLR | _]} = Avps]
  496:         = call(Config, Req),
  497: 
  498:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-OLR',
  499:                   value = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' := 1,
  500:                             'OC-Report-Type' := 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
  501:                             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' := [25],
  502:                             'OC-Validity-Duration' := [60],
  503:                             'AVP' := [OSF]}}
  504:         = OLR,
  505:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-Supported-Features',
  506:                   value = #{} = Fs}
  507:         = OSF,
  508:     0 = maps:size(Fs),
  509: 
  510:     #group{client_dict = D} = group(Config), 
  511: 
  512:     if D == nas4005 ->
  513:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  514:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  515:                 = Avps,
  516:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  517:                           value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  518:                 = Failed,
  519:             #diameter_avp{name = 'NAS-Port',
  520:                           value = 44}
  521:                 = NP,
  522:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  523:                           value = 12}
  524:                 = FR,
  525:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  526:                           value = 13}
  527:                 = AP;
  528: 
  529:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
  530:        D == diameter_gen_basr_accounting ->
  531:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  532:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  533:                 = Avps,
  534: 
  535:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  536:                            value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  537:                 = Failed,
  538:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  539:                           value = undefined}
  540:                 = NP,
  541:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  542:                           value = 12}
  543:                 = FR,
  544:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  545:                           value = 13}
  546:                 = AP;
  547: 
  548:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc6733;
  549:        D == diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733 ->
  550:             #{'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}],
  551:               'AVP' := [_]}
  552:                 = Avps,
  553:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  554:                           value = undefined}
  555:                 = NP,
  556:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  557:                           value = 12}
  558:                 = FR,
  559:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  560:                           value = 13}
  561:                 = AP
  562:     end.
  563: 
  564: %% Send a 3xxx Experimental-Result in an answer not setting the E-bit
  565: %% and missing a Result-Code.
  566: send_experimental_result(Config) ->
  567:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  568:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 5}],
  569:     ['ACA' | #{'Session-Id' := _}]
  570:         = call(Config, Req).
  571: 
  572: %% Send an ASR with an arbitrary non-mandatory AVP and expect success
  573: %% and the same AVP in the reply.
  574: send_arbitrary(Config) ->
  575:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  576:                                          value = "XXX"}]}],
  577:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  578:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  579:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  580:                                        value = V}]}]
  581:         = call(Config, Req),
  582:     "XXX" = string(V, Config).
  583: 
  584: %% Send Proxy-Info in an ASR that the peer answers with 3xxx, and
  585: %% ensure that the AVP is returned.
  586: send_proxy_info(Config) ->
  587:     H0 = ?B(?util:unique_string()),
  588:     S0 = ?B(?util:unique_string()),
  589:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', #{'Proxy-Host'  => H0,
  590:                                    'Proxy-State' => S0}}],
  591:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := 3999,
  592:                           'Proxy-Info' := [#{'Proxy-Host' := H,
  593:                                              'Proxy-State' := S}]}]
  594:         = call(Config, Req),
  595:     [H0, S0] = [?B(X) || X <- [H,S]].
  596: 
  597: %% Send an unknown AVP (to some client) and check that it comes back.
  598: send_unknown(Config) ->
  599:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  600:                                          is_mandatory = false,
  601:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  602:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  603:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  604:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  605:                                        is_mandatory = false,
  606:                                        data = <<17>>}]}]
  607:         = call(Config, Req).
  608: 
  609: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  610: %% 5014.
  611: send_unknown_short(Config) ->
  612:     send_unknown_short(Config, false, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  613: 
  614: send_unknown_short(Config, M, RC) ->
  615:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  616:                                          is_mandatory = M,
  617:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  618:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  619:                'Result-Code' := RC,
  620:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  621:         = call(Config, Req),
  622:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  623:                   is_mandatory = M,
  624:                   data = <<17, _/binary>>} %% extra bits from padding
  625:         = Avp.
  626: 
  627: %% Ditto but set the M flag.
  628: send_unknown_mandatory(Config) ->
  629:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  630:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  631:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  632:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  633:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  634:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  635:         = call(Config, Req),
  636:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  637:                   is_mandatory = true,
  638:                   data = <<17>>}
  639:         = Avp.
  640: 
  641: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  642: %% 5014 instead of 5001.
  643: send_unknown_short_mandatory(Config) ->
  644:     send_unknown_short(Config, true, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  645: 
  646: %% Send an ASR containing an unexpected mandatory Session-Timeout.
  647: %% Expect 5001, and check that the value in Failed-AVP was decoded.
  648: send_unexpected_mandatory_decode(Config) ->
  649:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 27,  %% Session-Timeout
  650:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  651:                                          data = <<12:32>>}]}],
  652:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  653:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  654:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  655:         = call(Config, Req),
  656:     #diameter_avp{code = 27,
  657:                   is_mandatory = true,
  658:                   value = 12,
  659:                   data = <<12:32>>}
  660:         = Avp.
  661: 
  662: %% Try to two Auth-Application-Id in ASR expect 5009.
  663: send_too_many(Config) ->
  664:     Req = ['ASR', {'Auth-Application-Id', [?APP_ID, 44]}],
  665: 
  666:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  667:                'Result-Code' := ?TOO_MANY,
  668:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  669:         = call(Config, Req),
  670:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Application-Id',
  671:                   value = 44}
  672:         = Avp.
  673: 
  674: %% Send an containing a faulty Grouped AVP (empty Proxy-Host in
  675: %% Proxy-Info) and expect that only the faulty AVP is sent in
  676: %% Failed-AVP. The encoded values of Proxy-Host and Proxy-State are
  677: %% swapped in prepare_request since an empty Proxy-Host is an encode
  678: %% error.
  679: send_grouped_error(Config) ->
  680:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', [[{'Proxy-Host', "abcd"},
  681:                                    {'Proxy-State', ""}]]}],
  682:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  683:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  684:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  685:         = call(Config, Req),
  686:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Proxy-Info', value = #{'Proxy-Host' := H}}
  687:         = Avp,
  688:     <<0>> = ?B(H).
  689: 
  690: %% Send an STR that the server ignores.
  691: send_noreply(Config) ->
  692:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  693:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  694: 
  695: %% Send an unsupported command and expect 3001.
  696: send_unsupported(Config) ->
  697:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  698:     ?answer_message(?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED)
  699:         = call(Config, Req).
  700: 
  701: %% Send an unsupported application and expect 3007.
  702: send_unsupported_app(Config) ->
  703:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  704:     ?answer_message(?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED)
  705:         = call(Config, Req).
  706: 
  707: %% Send a request with the E bit set and expect 3008.
  708: send_error_bit(Config) ->
  709:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  710:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_HDR_BITS)
  711:         = call(Config, Req).
  712: 
  713: %% Send a bad version and check that we get 5011.
  714: send_unsupported_version(Config) ->
  715:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  716:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  717:                'Result-Code' := ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION}]
  718:         = call(Config, Req).
  719: 
  720: %% Send a request containing an AVP length > data size.
  721: send_long_avp_length(Config) ->
  722:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  723: 
  724: %% Send a request containing an AVP length < data size.
  725: send_short_avp_length(Config) ->
  726:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  727: 
  728: %% Send a request containing an AVP whose advertised length is < 8.
  729: send_zero_avp_length(Config) ->
  730:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  731: 
  732: %% Send a request containing an AVP length that doesn't match the
  733: %% AVP's type.
  734: send_invalid_avp_length(Config) ->
  735:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  736: 
  737:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  738:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  739:                'Origin-Host' := _,
  740:                'Origin-Realm' := _,
  741:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [_]}]}]
  742:         = call(Config, Req).
  743: 
  744: %% Send a request containing 5xxx errors that the server rejects with
  745: %% 3xxx.
  746: send_invalid_reject(Config) ->
  747:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?USER_MOVED}],
  748: 
  749:     ?answer_message(?TOO_BUSY)
  750:         = call(Config, Req).
  751: 
  752: %% Send an STR containing a known AVP, but one that's not expected and
  753: %% that sets the M-bit.
  754: send_unexpected_mandatory(Config) ->
  755:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  756: 
  757:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  758:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED}]
  759:         = call(Config, Req).
  760: 
  761: %% Send something long that will be fragmented by TCP.
  762: send_long(Config) ->
  763:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  764:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 20)]}],
  765:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  766:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  767:         = call(Config, Req).
  768: 
  769: %% Send something longer than the configure incoming_maxlen.
  770: send_maxlen(Config) ->
  771:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  772:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 21)]}],
  773:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  774: 
  775: %% Send something for which pick_peer finds no suitable peer.
  776: send_nopeer(Config) ->
  777:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  778:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [?EXTRA]}]).
  779: 
  780: %% Send something on an unconfigured application.
  781: send_noapp(Config) ->
  782:     #group{client_service = CN}
  783:         = group(Config),
  784:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  785:     {error, no_connection} = diameter:call(CN, unknown_alias, Req).
  786: 
  787: %% Send something that's discarded by prepare_request.
  788: send_discard(Config) ->
  789:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  790:     {error, unprepared} = call(Config, Req).
  791: 
  792: %% Send with a disjunctive filter.
  793: send_any_1(Config) ->
  794:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  795:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {any, []}}]).
  796: send_any_2(Config) ->
  797:     #group{server_service = SN}
  798:         = group(Config),
  799:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  800:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  801:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  802:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {first, [{all, [host, realm]},
  803:                                                realm]}}]).
  804: 
  805: %% Send with a conjunctive filter.
  806: send_all_1(Config) ->
  807:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  808:     Realm = lists:foldr(fun(C,A) -> [C,A] end, [], ?REALM),
  809:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  810:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  811:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [{host, any},
  812:                                              {realm, Realm}]}}]).
  813: send_all_2(Config) ->
  814:     #group{server_service = SN}
  815:         = group(Config),
  816:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  817:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  818:     {error, no_connection}
  819:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  820: 
  821: %% Timeout before the server manages an answer.
  822: send_timeout(Config) ->
  823:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_ONLY}],
  824:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req, [{timeout, 1000}]).
  825: 
  826: %% Explicitly answer with an answer-message and ensure that we
  827: %% received the Session-Id.
  828: send_error(Config) ->
  829:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE}],
  830:     ?answer_message([_], ?TOO_BUSY)
  831:         = call(Config, Req).
  832: 
  833: %% Send a request with the detached option and receive it as a message
  834: %% from handle_answer instead.
  835: send_detach(Config) ->
  836:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  837:     Ref = make_ref(),
  838:     ok = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [{self(), Ref}]}, detach]),
  839:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  840:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  841:         = receive {Ref, T} -> T end.
  842: 
  843: %% Send a request which can't be encoded and expect {error, encode}.
  844: send_encode_error(Config) ->
  845:     {error, encode} = call(Config, ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', huh}]).
  846: 
  847: %% Send with filtering and expect success.
  848: send_destination_1(Config) ->
  849:     #group{server_service = SN}
  850:         = group(Config),
  851:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  852:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}],
  853:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  854:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  855:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  856: send_destination_2(Config) ->
  857:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  858:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  859:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  860:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  861: 
  862: %% Send with filtering on and expect failure when specifying an
  863: %% unknown host or realm.
  864: send_destination_3(Config) ->
  865:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  866:                   {'Destination-Realm', <<"unknown.org">>}],
  867:     {error, no_connection}
  868:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  869: send_destination_4(Config) ->
  870:     #group{server_service = SN}
  871:         = group(Config),
  872:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  873:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ["unknown.org"])]}],
  874:     {error, no_connection}
  875:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  876: 
  877: %% Send without filtering and expect an error answer when specifying
  878: %% an unknown host or realm.
  879: send_destination_5(Config) ->
  880:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  881:                   {'Destination-Realm', [<<"unknown.org">>]}],
  882:     ?answer_message(?REALM_NOT_SERVED)
  883:         = call(Config, Req).
  884: send_destination_6(Config) ->
  885:     #group{server_service = SN}
  886:         = group(Config),
  887:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  888:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  889:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  890:         = call(Config, Req).
  891: 
  892: %% Specify an invalid option and expect failure.
  893: send_bad_option_1(Config) ->
  894:     send_bad_option(Config, x).
  895: send_bad_option_2(Config) ->
  896:     send_bad_option(Config, {extra, false}).
  897: 
  898: send_bad_option(Config, Opt) ->
  899:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  900:     try call(Config, Req, [Opt]) of
  901:         T -> erlang:error({?MODULE, ?LINE, T})
  902:     catch
  903:         error: _ -> ok
  904:     end.
  905: 
  906: %% Specify an invalid filter and expect no matching peers.
  907: send_bad_filter_1(Config) ->
  908:     send_bad_filter(Config, {all, none}).
  909: send_bad_filter_2(Config) ->
  910:     send_bad_filter(Config, {host, x}).
  911: send_bad_filter_3(Config) ->
  912:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, fun() -> true end}).
  913: send_bad_filter_4(Config) ->
  914:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, {?MODULE, not_exported, []}}).
  915: 
  916: send_bad_filter(Config, F) ->
  917:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  918:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, F}]).
  919: 
  920: %% Specify multiple filter options and expect them be conjunctive.
  921: send_multiple_filters_1(Config) ->
  922:     Fun = fun(#diameter_caps{}) -> true end,
  923:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  924:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  925:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [host, {eval, Fun}]).
  926: send_multiple_filters_2(Config) ->
  927:     E = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
  928:     {error, no_connection}
  929:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [realm, {neg, {eval, E}}]).
  930: send_multiple_filters_3(Config) ->
  931:     E1 = [fun(#diameter_caps{}, ok) -> true end, ok],
  932:     E2 = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
  933:     E3 = {erlang, is_record, [diameter_caps]},
  934:     E4 = [{erlang, is_record, []}, diameter_caps],
  935:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  936:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  937:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [{eval, E} || E <- [E1,E2,E3,E4]]).
  938: 
  939: send_multiple_filters(Config, Fs) ->
  940:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  941:     call(Config, Req, [{filter, F} || F <- Fs]).
  942: 
  943: %% Ensure that we can pass a request in any form to diameter:call/4,
  944: %% only the return value from the prepare_request callback being
  945: %% significant.
  946: send_anything(Config) ->
  947:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  948:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  949:         = call(Config, anything).
  950: 
  951: %% ===========================================================================
  952: 
  953: group(#group{} = Rec) ->
  954:     Rec;
  955: group(Config) ->
  956:     #group{} = proplists:get_value(group, Config).
  957: 
  958: string(V, Config) ->
  959:     #group{strings = B} = group(Config),
  960:     decode(V,B).
  961: 
  962: decode(S, true)
  963:   when is_list(S) ->
  964:     S;
  965: decode(B, false)
  966:   when is_binary(B) ->
  967:     binary_to_list(B).
  968: 
  969: call(Config, Req) ->
  970:     call(Config, Req, []).
  971: 
  972: call(Config, Req, Opts) ->
  973:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
  974:     #group{encoding = Enc,
  975:            client_service = CN,
  976:            client_dict = Dict0}
  977:         = group(Config),
  978:     diameter:call(CN,
  979:                   dict(Req, Dict0),
  980:                   msg(Req, Enc, Dict0),
  981:                   [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]} | Opts]).
  982: 
  983: origin({D,E}) ->
  984:     4*decode(D) + encode(E);
  985: 
  986: origin(N) ->
  987:     {decode(N bsr 2), encode(N rem 4)}.
  988: 
  989: %% Map atoms. The atoms are part of (constructed) group names, so it's
  990: %% good that they're readable.
  991: 
  992: decode(record) -> 0;
  993: decode(list)   -> 1;
  994: decode(map)    -> 2;
  995: decode(none)   -> 3;
  996: decode(record_from_map) -> 4;
  997: decode(0) -> record;
  998: decode(1) -> list;
  999: decode(2) -> map;
 1000: decode(3) -> none;
 1001: decode(4) -> record_from_map.
 1002: 
 1003: encode(record) -> 0;
 1004: encode(list)   -> 1;
 1005: encode(map)    -> 2;
 1006: encode(0) -> record;
 1007: encode(1) -> list;
 1008: encode(2) -> map.
 1009: 
 1010: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588)
 1011:   when H == 'ACR';
 1012:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1013:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_base_accounting);
 1014: 
 1015: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733)
 1016:   when H == 'ACR';
 1017:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1018:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733);
 1019: 
 1020: msg([H|T], record, Dict) ->
 1021:     Dict:'#new-'(Dict:msg2rec(H), T);
 1022: 
 1023: msg([H|As], map, _)
 1024:   when is_list(As) ->
 1025:     [H | maps:from_list(As)];
 1026: 
 1027: msg(Msg, _, _) ->
 1028:     Msg.
 1029: 
 1030: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [_MsgName | Avps] = Msg},
 1031:        #group{server_decoding = map})
 1032:   when is_map(Avps) ->
 1033:     Msg;
 1034: 
 1035: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | Avps]},
 1036:        #group{server_decoding = list}) ->
 1037:     [MsgName | maps:from_list(Avps)];
 1038: 
 1039: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Rec},
 1040:        #group{server_decoding = D})
 1041:   when D == record;
 1042:        D == record_from_map ->
 1043:     rec_to_map(Rec, dict(H));
 1044: 
 1045: %% No record decode: do it ourselves.
 1046: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H,
 1047:                         msg = Name,
 1048:                         bin = Bin},
 1049:       #group{server_decoding = none,
 1050:              strings = B}) ->
 1051:     Opts = #{decode_format => map,
 1052:              string_decode => B,
 1053:              avp_dictionaries => [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683],
 1054:              strict_mbit => true,
 1055:              rfc => 6733},
 1056:     #diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | _Map] = Msg}
 1057:         = diameter_codec:decode(dict(H), Opts, Bin),
 1058:     {MsgName, _} = {Name, Msg},  %% assert
 1059:     Msg.
 1060: 
 1061: dict(#diameter_header{application_id = Id,
 1062:                       cmd_code = Code}) ->
 1063:     if Id == 1 ->
 1064:             nas4005;
 1065:        Code == 271 ->
 1066:             diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1067:        true ->
 1068:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1069:     end.
 1070: 
 1071: rec_to_map(Rec, Dict) ->
 1072:     [R | Vs] = Dict:'#get-'(Rec),
 1073:     [Dict:rec2msg(R) | maps:from_list([T || {_,V} = T <- Vs,
 1074:                                             V /= undefined,
 1075:                                             V /= []])].
 1076: 
 1077: appdict(rfc4005) ->
 1078:     nas4005;
 1079: appdict(D) ->
 1080:     dict0(D).
 1081: 
 1082: dict0(D) ->
 1083:     ?A("diameter_gen_base_" ++ ?L(D)).
 1084: 
 1085: dict(Msg, Dict) ->
 1086:     d(name(Msg), Dict).
 1087: 
 1088: d(N, nas4005 = D) ->
 1089:     if N == {list, 'answer-message'};
 1090:        N == {map, 'answer-message'};
 1091:        N == {record, 'diameter_base_answer-message'} ->
 1092:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
 1093:        true ->
 1094:             D
 1095:     end;
 1096: d(N, Dict0)
 1097:   when N == {list, 'ACR'};
 1098:        N == {list, 'ACA'};
 1099:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1100:        N == {map, 'ACA'};
 1101:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1102:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACA} ->
 1103:     acct(Dict0);
 1104: d(_, Dict0) ->
 1105:     Dict0.
 1106: 
 1107: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc3588) ->
 1108:     diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1109: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc6733) ->
 1110:     diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733.
 1111: 
 1112: %% Set only values that aren't already.
 1113: 
 1114: set(_, [N | As], Vs) ->
 1115:     [N | if is_map(As) ->
 1116:                  maps:merge(maps:from_list(Vs), As);
 1117:             is_list(As) ->
 1118:                  Vs ++ As
 1119:          end];
 1120: 
 1121: set(#group{client_dict = Dict0} = _Group, Rec, Vs) ->
 1122:     Dict = dict(Rec, Dict0),
 1123:     lists:foldl(fun({F,_} = FV, A) ->
 1124:                         reset(Dict, Dict:'#get-'(F, A), FV, A)
 1125:                 end,
 1126:                 Rec,
 1127:                 Vs).
 1128: 
 1129: reset(Dict, E, FV, Rec)
 1130:   when E == undefined;
 1131:        E == [] ->
 1132:     Dict:'#set-'(FV, Rec);
 1133: 
 1134: reset(_, _, _, Rec) ->
 1135:     Rec.
 1136: 
 1137: %% ===========================================================================
 1138: %% diameter callbacks
 1139: 
 1140: %% peer_up/4
 1141: 
 1142: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1143:     State.
 1144: 
 1145: %% peer_down/3
 1146: 
 1147: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1148:     State.
 1149: 
 1150: %% pick_peer/7-8
 1151: 
 1152: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, Name, _)
 1153:   when Name /= send_detach ->
 1154:     find(Group, Peers).
 1155: 
 1156: pick_peer(_Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, _Group, send_nopeer, _, ?EXTRA) ->
 1157:     false;
 1158: 
 1159: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, send_detach, _, {_,_}) ->
 1160:     find(Group, Peers).
 1161: 
 1162: find(#group{encoding = E,
 1163:             client_service = CN,
 1164:             server_decoding = D},
 1165:      [_|_] = Peers) ->
 1166:     Id = {D,E},
 1167:     [P] = [P || P <- Peers, id(Id, P, CN)],
 1168:     {ok, P}.
 1169: 
 1170: id(Id, {Pid, _Caps}, SvcName) ->
 1171:     [{ref, _}, {type, _}, {options, Opts} | _]
 1172:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, Pid),
 1173:     lists:member({id, Id}, Opts).
 1174: 
 1175: %% prepare_request/6-7
 1176: 
 1177: prepare_request(_Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, _Caps}, _, send_discard, _) ->
 1178:     {discard, unprepared};
 1179: 
 1180: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, Name, _) ->
 1181:     {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Name, Group)}.
 1182: 
 1183: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, send_detach, _, _) ->
 1184:     {eval_packet, {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)}, [fun log/2, detach]}.
 1185: 
 1186: log(#diameter_packet{bin = Bin} = P, T)
 1187:   when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1188:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [T,P]).
 1189: 
 1190: %% prepare/4
 1191: 
 1192: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1193:   when N == send_unknown_short_mandatory;
 1194:        N == send_unknown_short ->
 1195:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1196: 
 1197:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1198:                      bin = Bin}
 1199:         = E
 1200:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1201: 
 1202:     %% Find the unknown AVP data at the end of the message and alter
 1203:     %% its length header.
 1204: 
 1205:     {Padding, [17|_]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C == 0 end,
 1206:                                        lists:reverse(binary_to_list(Bin))),
 1207: 
 1208:     Offset = L - length(Padding) - 4,
 1209:     <<H:Offset/binary, Len:24, T/binary>> = Bin,
 1210:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, (Len+9):24, T/binary>>};
 1211: 
 1212: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1213:   when N == send_long_avp_length;
 1214:        N == send_short_avp_length;
 1215:        N == send_zero_avp_length ->
 1216:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1217:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1218:     %% Unsigned32: set AVP Length to a value other than 12 and place
 1219:     %% it last in the message (so as not to mess with Termination-Cause).
 1220:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1221:                      bin = B}
 1222:         = E
 1223:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1224:     Offset = L - 24,  %% to Auth-Application-Id
 1225:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1226:       Hdr:5/binary, 12:24, Data:4/binary,
 1227:       T:12/binary>>
 1228:         = B,
 1229:     AL = case N of
 1230:              send_long_avp_length  -> 13;
 1231:              send_short_avp_length -> 11;
 1232:              send_zero_avp_length  -> 0
 1233:          end,
 1234:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1235:                               T/binary,
 1236:                               Hdr/binary, AL:24, Data/binary>>};
 1237: 
 1238: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1239:   when N == send_invalid_avp_length;
 1240:        N == send_invalid_reject ->
 1241:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1242:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1243:     %% Unsigned32: send data of length 8.
 1244:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1245:                      bin = B0}
 1246:         = E
 1247:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1248:     Offset = L - 7 - 12,  %% to AVP Length
 1249:     <<H0:Offset/binary, 12:24, T:16/binary>> = B0,
 1250:     <<V, L:24, H/binary>> = H0,  %% assert
 1251:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (L+4):24, H/binary, 16:24, 0:32, T/binary>>};
 1252: 
 1253: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unexpected_mandatory, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1254:                                               = Group) ->
 1255:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1256:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<V, Len:24, T/binary>>}
 1257:         = E
 1258:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1259:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-State'),
 1260:     Avp = <<Code:32, Flags, 8:24>>,
 1261:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (Len+8):24, T/binary, Avp/binary>>};
 1262: 
 1263: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_grouped_error, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1264:                                               = Group) ->
 1265:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1266:     #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}
 1267:         = E
 1268:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1269:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-Info'),
 1270:     %% Find Proxy-Info by looking for its header.
 1271:     Pattern = <<Code:32, Flags, 28:24>>,
 1272:     {Offset, 8} = binary:match(Bin, Pattern),
 1273: 
 1274:     %% Extract and swap Proxy-Host/State payloads.
 1275: 
 1276:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1277:       PI:8/binary,
 1278:       PH:5/binary,
 1279:       12:24,
 1280:       Payload:4/binary,
 1281:       PS:5/binary,
 1282:       8:24,
 1283:       T/binary>>
 1284:         = Bin,
 1285: 
 1286:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1287:                               PI/binary,
 1288:                               PH/binary,
 1289:                               8:24,
 1290:                               PS:5/binary,
 1291:                               12:24,
 1292:                               Payload/binary,
 1293:                               T/binary>>};
 1294: 
 1295: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group) ->
 1296:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1297:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:5/binary, _CmdCode:3/binary, T/binary>>}
 1298:         = E
 1299:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1300:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, 42:24, T/binary>>};
 1301: 
 1302: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_app, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1303:                                          = Group) ->
 1304:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1305:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:8/binary, _ApplId:4/binary, T/binary>>}
 1306:         = E
 1307:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1308:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, ?BAD_APP:32, T/binary>>};
 1309: 
 1310: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_error_bit, Group) ->
 1311:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1312:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{is_error = true},
 1313:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1314: 
 1315: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_version, Group) ->
 1316:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1317:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{version = 42},
 1318:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1319: 
 1320: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_anything, Group) ->
 1321:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1322:     prepare(Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group);
 1323: 
 1324: prepare(Pkt, Caps, _Name, Group) ->
 1325:     prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1326: 
 1327: %% prepare/3
 1328: 
 1329: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req} = Pkt, Caps, Group) ->
 1330:     set(name(Req), Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1331: 
 1332: %% set/4
 1333: 
 1334: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1335:   when N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1336:        N == {record, nas_ACR};
 1337:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1338:        N == {list, 'ACR'} ->
 1339:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1340:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1341:         = Caps,
 1342: 
 1343:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1344:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1345:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1346:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]}]);
 1347: 
 1348: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1349:   when N == {record, diameter_base_ASR};
 1350:        N == {record, nas_ASR};
 1351:        N == {map, 'ASR'};
 1352:        N == {list, 'ASR'} ->
 1353:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1354:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1355:         = Caps,
 1356:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1357:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1358:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1359:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1360:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1361:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1362: 
 1363: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1364:   when N == {record, diameter_base_STR};
 1365:        N == {record, nas_STR};
 1366:        N == {map, 'STR'};
 1367:        N == {list, 'STR'} ->
 1368:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1369:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1370:         = Caps,
 1371:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1372:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1373:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1374:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1375:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1376: 
 1377: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1378:   when N == {record, diameter_base_RAR};
 1379:        N == {record, nas_RAR};
 1380:        N == {map, 'RAR'};
 1381:        N == {list, 'RAR'} ->
 1382:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1383:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1384:         = Caps,
 1385:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1386:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1387:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1388:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1389:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1390:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]).
 1391: 
 1392: %% name/1
 1393: 
 1394: name([H|#{}]) ->
 1395:     {map, H};
 1396: 
 1397: name([H|_]) ->
 1398:     {list, H};
 1399: 
 1400: name(Rec) ->
 1401:     try
 1402:         {record, element(1, Rec)}
 1403:     catch
 1404:         error: badarg ->
 1405:             false
 1406:     end.
 1407: 
 1408: %% prepare_retransmit/6
 1409: 
 1410: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer, _Group, _Name, _) ->
 1411:     discard.
 1412: 
 1413: %% handle_answer/7-8
 1414: 
 1415: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, Name, _) ->
 1416:     answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group).
 1417: 
 1418: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, send_detach = Name, _, X) ->
 1419:     {Pid, Ref} = X,
 1420:     Pid ! {Ref, answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group)}.
 1421: 
 1422: answer(Pkt, Req, _Peer, Name, #group{client_dict = Dict0}) ->
 1423:     #diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Ans, errors = Es} = Pkt,
 1424:     ApplId = app(Req, Name, Dict0),
 1425:     #diameter_header{application_id = ApplId} = H,  %% assert
 1426:     answer(Ans, Es, Name).
 1427: 
 1428: %% Missing Result-Code and inappropriate Experimental-Result-Code.
 1429: answer(Ans, Es, send_experimental_result) ->
 1430:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result'}},
 1431:      {5005, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}}]
 1432:         =  Es,
 1433:     Ans;
 1434: 
 1435: %% An inappropriate E-bit results in a decode error ...
 1436: answer(Ans, Es, send_bad_answer) ->
 1437:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}} | _] = Es,
 1438:     Ans;
 1439: 
 1440: %% ... while other errors are reflected in Failed-AVP.
 1441: answer(Ans, [], _) ->
 1442:     Ans.
 1443: 
 1444: app(_, send_unsupported_app, _) ->
 1445:     ?BAD_APP;
 1446: app(Req, _, Dict0) ->
 1447:     Dict = dict(Req, Dict0),
 1448:     Dict:id().
 1449: 
 1450: %% handle_error/7
 1451: 
 1452: handle_error(timeout = Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, Time) ->
 1453:     Now = diameter_lib:now(),
 1454:     {Reason, {diameter_lib:timestamp(Time),
 1455:               diameter_lib:timestamp(Now),
 1456:               diameter_lib:micro_diff(Now, Time)}};
 1457: 
 1458: handle_error(Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, _Time) ->
 1459:     {error, Reason}.
 1460: 
 1461: %% handle_request/4
 1462: 
 1463: %% Note that diameter will set Result-Code and Failed-AVPs if
 1464: %% #diameter_packet.errors is non-null.
 1465: 
 1466: handle_request(#diameter_packet{header = H, avps = As}
 1467:                = Pkt,
 1468:                _,
 1469:                {_Ref, Caps},
 1470:                #group{encoding = E,
 1471:                       server_decoding = D}
 1472:                = Grp) ->
 1473:     #diameter_header{end_to_end_id = EI,
 1474:                      hop_by_hop_id = HI}
 1475:         = H,
 1476:     {V,B} = ?CLIENT_MASK,
 1477:     V = EI bsr B,  %% assert
 1478:     V = HI bsr B,  %%
 1479:     #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {_,[Id]}} = Caps,
 1480:     {D,E} = T = origin(Id),  %% assert
 1481:     wrap(T, H, request(to_map(Pkt, Grp), [H|As], Caps)).
 1482: 
 1483: wrap(Id, H, {Tag, Action, Post}) ->
 1484:     {Tag, wrap(Id, H, Action), Post};
 1485: 
 1486: wrap(_, _, {reply, [#diameter_header{} | _]} = T) ->
 1487:     T;
 1488: 
 1489: wrap({_,E}, H, {reply, Ans}) ->
 1490:     Msg = base_to_nas(msg(Ans, E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588), H),
 1491:     {reply, wrap(Msg)};
 1492: 
 1493: wrap(_, _, T) ->
 1494:     T.
 1495: 
 1496: %% Randomly wrap the answer in a diameter_packet.
 1497: 
 1498: wrap(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt) ->
 1499:     Pkt;
 1500: 
 1501: wrap(Msg) ->
 1502:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 1503:         1 -> #diameter_packet{msg = Msg};
 1504:         2 -> Msg
 1505:     end.
 1506: 
 1507: %% base_to_nas/2
 1508: 
 1509: base_to_nas(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg} = Pkt, H) ->
 1510:     Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = base_to_nas(Msg, H)};
 1511: 
 1512: base_to_nas(Rec, #diameter_header{application_id = 1})
 1513:   when is_tuple(Rec), not ?is_record(Rec, 'diameter_base_answer-message') ->
 1514:     D = case element(1, Rec) of
 1515:             diameter_base_accounting_ACA ->
 1516:                 diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1517:             _ ->
 1518:                 diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1519:         end,
 1520:     [R | Values] = D:'#get-'(Rec),
 1521:     "diameter_base_" ++ N = ?L(R),
 1522:     Name = ?A("nas_" ++ if N == "accounting_ACA" ->
 1523:                                 "ACA";
 1524:                            true ->
 1525:                                 N
 1526:                         end),
 1527:     nas4005:'#new-'([Name | Values]);
 1528: 
 1529: base_to_nas(Msg, _) ->
 1530:     Msg.
 1531: 
 1532: %% request/3
 1533: 
 1534: %% send_experimental_result
 1535: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 5}],
 1536:         [Hdr | Avps],
 1537:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1538:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1539:     [H,R|T] = [A || N <- ['Origin-Host',
 1540:                           'Origin-Realm',
 1541:                           'Session-Id',
 1542:                           'Accounting-Record-Type',
 1543:                           'Accounting-Record-Number'],
 1544:                     #diameter_avp{} = A
 1545:                         <- [lists:keyfind(N, #diameter_avp.name, Avps)]],
 1546:     Ans = [Hdr#diameter_header{is_request = false},
 1547:            H#diameter_avp{data = OH},
 1548:            R#diameter_avp{data = OR},
 1549:            #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result',
 1550:                          code = 297,
 1551:                          need_encryption = false,
 1552:                          data = [#diameter_avp{data = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1553:                                                        'Vendor-Id',
 1554:                                                        123}},
 1555:                                  #diameter_avp{data
 1556:                                                = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1557:                                                   'Experimental-Result-Code',
 1558:                                                   3987}}]}
 1559:            | T],
 1560:     {reply, Ans};
 1561: 
 1562: request(Msg, _Avps, Caps) ->
 1563:     request(Msg, Caps).
 1564: 
 1565: %% request/2
 1566: 
 1567: %% send_nok
 1568: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 0}],
 1569:         _) ->
 1570:     {eval_packet, {protocol_error, ?INVALID_AVP_BITS}, [fun log/2, invalid]};
 1571: 
 1572: %% send_bad_answer
 1573: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1574:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1575:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 2 = RN}],
 1576:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1577:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1578:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1579:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1580:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1581:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1582:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1583:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1584: 
 1585:     {reply, #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{is_error = true},%% NOT
 1586:                              msg = Ans}};
 1587: 
 1588: %% send_eval
 1589: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1590:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1591:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 3 = RN}],
 1592:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1593:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1594:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1595:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1596:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1597:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1598:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1599:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1600:     {eval, {reply, Ans}, {erlang, now, []}};
 1601: 
 1602: %% send_ok
 1603: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1604:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1605:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 1 = RN}],
 1606:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1607:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1608:     {reply, ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1609:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1610:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1611:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1612:                     {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1613:                     {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}]};
 1614: 
 1615: %% send_protocol_error
 1616: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 4}],
 1617:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1618:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1619:     %% Include a DOIC AVP that will be encoded/decoded because of
 1620:     %% avp_dictionaries config.
 1621:     OLR = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' => 1,
 1622:             'OC-Report-Type' => 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
 1623:             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' => [25],
 1624:             'OC-Validity-Duration' => [60],
 1625:             'AVP' => [{'OC-Supported-Features', []}]},
 1626:     %% Include a NAS Failed-AVP AVP that will only be decoded under
 1627:     %% that application. Encode as 'AVP' since RFC 3588 doesn't list
 1628:     %% Failed-AVP in the answer-message grammar while RFC 6733 does.
 1629:     NP = #diameter_avp{data = {nas4005, 'NAS-Port', 44}},
 1630:     FR = #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision', value = 12}, %% M=0
 1631:     AP = #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period', value = 13}, %% M=1
 1632:     Failed = #diameter_avp{data = {diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
 1633:                                    'Failed-AVP',
 1634:                                    [{'AVP', [NP,FR,AP]}]}},
 1635:     Ans = ['answer-message', {'Result-Code', ?TOO_BUSY},
 1636:                              {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1637:                              {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1638:                              {'AVP', [{'OC-OLR', OLR}, Failed]}],
 1639:     {reply, Ans};
 1640: 
 1641: %% send_proxy_info
 1642: request(['ASR' | #{'Proxy-Info' := _}],
 1643:         _) ->
 1644:     {protocol_error, 3999};
 1645: 
 1646: request(['ASR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId} = Avps],
 1647:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1648:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1649:     {reply, ['ASA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1650:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1651:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1652:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1653:                     {'AVP', maps:get('AVP', Avps, [])}]};
 1654: 
 1655: %% send_invalid_reject
 1656: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := ?USER_MOVED}],
 1657:         _Caps) ->
 1658:     {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY};
 1659: 
 1660: %% send_noreply
 1661: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := T}],
 1662:         _Caps)
 1663:   when T /= ?LOGOUT ->
 1664:     discard;
 1665: 
 1666: %% send_destination_5
 1667: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Realm' := R}],
 1668:         #diameter_caps{origin_realm = {OR, _}})
 1669:   when R /= undefined, R /= OR ->
 1670:     {protocol_error, ?REALM_NOT_SERVED};
 1671: 
 1672: %% send_destination_6
 1673: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Host' := [H]}],
 1674:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _}})
 1675:   when H /= OH ->
 1676:     {protocol_error, ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER};
 1677: 
 1678: request(['STR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId}],
 1679:         #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1680:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1681:     {reply, ['STA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1682:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1683:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1684:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR}]};
 1685: 
 1686: %% send_error/send_timeout
 1687: request(['RAR' | #{}], _Caps) ->
 1688:     receive after 2000 -> {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY} end.
 1689: 
 1690: %% message/3
 1691: %%
 1692: %% Limit the number of messages received. More can be received if read
 1693: %% in the same packet.
 1694: 
 1695: message(recv = D, {[_], Bin}, N) ->
 1696:     message(D, Bin, N);
 1697: message(Dir, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}, N) ->
 1698:     message(Dir, Bin, N);
 1699: 
 1700: %% incoming request
 1701: message(recv, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>> = Bin, N) ->
 1702:     [Bin, N < 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N+1];
 1703: 
 1704: %% incoming answer
 1705: message(recv, Bin, _) ->
 1706:     [Bin];
 1707: 
 1708: %% outgoing
 1709: message(send, Bin, _) ->
 1710:     [Bin];
 1711: 
 1712: %% sent request
 1713: message(ack, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>>, _) ->
 1714:     [];
 1715: 
 1716: %% sent answer or discarded request
 1717: message(ack, _, N) ->
 1718:     [N =< 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N-1].
 1719: 
 1720: %% ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1721: 
 1722: compile_and_load() ->
 1723:     Path = hd([P || H <- [[here(), ".."], [code:lib_dir(diameter)]],
 1724:                     P <- [filename:join(H ++ ["examples",
 1725:                                               "dict",
 1726:                                               "rfc4005_nas.dia"])],
 1727:                     {ok, _} <- [file:read_file_info(P)]]),
 1728:     Opts = [return,
 1729:             forms,
 1730:             {name, "nas4005"},
 1731:             {prefix, "nas"},
 1732:             {inherits, "common/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588"}],
 1733:     {ok, [Forms]} = diameter_make:codec(Path, Opts),
 1734:     {ok, nas4005, Bin, []} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info, return]),
 1735:     {module, nas4005} = code:load_binary(nas4005, "nas4005", Bin).
 1736: 
 1737: here() ->
 1738:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
